desmoj.extensions.crossbar

Class MessageChannel<T extends SimProcess>

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.simulator.NamedObject
      • desmoj.core.simulator.ModelComponent
        • desmoj.core.simulator.Reportable
          • desmoj.extensions.crossbar.MessageChannel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Parameter restricting the types of processes which can wait on a MessageChannel.

    public class MessageChannel<T extends SimProcess>
extends Reportable
    Represents a message channel which resides on a MessageCrossbar. MessageChannels can only be used in conjunction with a message crossbar.

    On the one hand MessageChannels allow for processes to wait for CrossbarMessages on them (passivating the process) and on the other hand they allow for processes to send CrossbarMessages to them. If a CrossbarMessage is received this leads to the immediate activation of all process waiting on the channel.
    See Also:
    MessageCrossbar, CrossbarMessage

    • Method Detail

      • getDeliveredMessages

        public long getDeliveredMessages()
        Returns:
        The number of delivered messages. A message is considered delivered if it was forwarded to at least one waiting process.

      • getDirectProcessActivations

        public java.lang.Object getDirectProcessActivations()
        Returns:
        The number of process which were activated by a message directly received on this channel.

      • getIndirectProcessActivations

        public long getIndirectProcessActivations()
        Returns:
        The number of process which were removed from this channel because they were activated (indirectly) by a message received on another channel.

      • getInterruptedWaits

        public long getInterruptedWaits()
        Returns:
        The number of process which were interrupted while waiting on this channel because their max wait time was exceeded.

      • getLostMessages

        public long getLostMessages()
        Returns:
        The number of message which were sent to this channel but couldn't be forwarded to a receiver because no process was waiting on the channel when the message was received.

      • getObservations

        public long getObservations()
        Description copied from class: Reportable
        Returns the number of observations made by the reportable object.
        Overrides:
        getObservations in class Reportable
        Returns:
        The number of processes which have been handled by this message channel (meaning processes which entered the channel and also left it again).

      • getProcessActivations

        public long getProcessActivations()
        Returns:
        The number of process which were removed from this channel because they were activated either by a message received directly on this channel or by a message received (indirectly) on another channel.

      • getReceivedMessages

        public long getReceivedMessages()
        Returns:
        The number of messages which were sent to this channel.

        Sends the given CrossbarMessage to the channel, thereby activating all processes that are waiting on the channel.

      • waitForMessage

        public CrossbarMessage waitForMessage()
        Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received.
        Returns:
        The message that was received.

      • waitForMessage

        public CrossbarMessage waitForMessage(TimeInstant waitUntil)
                               throws DelayedInterruptException
        Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter waitUntil specifies the point in time to which the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before that time the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        waitUntil - The point in time up to which the process will wait for a message before the waiting is aborted.
        Returns:
        The message that was received.
        Throws:
        DelayedInterruptException - The exception that indicates the process has reached its max wait time and has been interrupted.

      • waitForMessage

        public CrossbarMessage waitForMessage(TimeSpan maxWaitTime)
                               throws DelayedInterruptException
        Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter maxWaitTime specifies the time the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before the wait time has passed the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        maxWaitTime - The time the process will wait for a message before the waiting is aborted.
        Returns:
        The message that was received.
        Throws:
        DelayedInterruptException - The exception that indicates the process has reached its max wait time and has been interrupted.
